dt: {bc}not affiliated with a larger controlling unit
{bc}not requiring or relying on something else {bc}not contingent
{bc}not looking to others for one's opinions or for guidance in conduct
{bc}not bound by or committed to a political party
{bc}not requiring or relying on others (as for care or livelihood)
{bc}being enough to free one from the necessity of working for a living
{bc}not determined by or capable of being deduced or derived from or expressed in terms of members (such as axioms or equations) of the set under consideration

{bc}having the property that the joint probability (as of events or samples) or the joint probability density function (as of random variables) equals the product of the probabilities or probability density functions of separate occurrence
{bc}neither deducible from nor incompatible with another statement

pt: {sc}free{/sc} {sc}independent{/sc} {sc}sovereign{/sc} {sc}autonomous{/sc} mean not subject to the rule or control of another. {sc}free{/sc} stresses the complete absence of external rule and the full right to make all of one's own decisions.

pt.t: you're {it}free{/it} to do as you like

pt: {sc}independent{/sc} implies a standing alone; applied to a state it implies lack of connection with any other having power to interfere with its citizens, laws, or policies.
{sc}sovereign{/sc} stresses the absence of a superior power and implies supremacy within a thing's own domain or sphere.
{sc}autonomous{/sc} stresses independence in matters pertaining to self-government.

pt.t: in this denomination each congregation is regarded as {it}autonomous{/it}

shortdef: not subject to control by others : self-governing
not affiliated with a larger controlling unit

dt: {bc}one that is not bound by or definitively committed to a political party

{bc}a sectarian of an English religious movement for congregational autonomy originating in the late 16th century, giving rise to Congregationalists, Baptists, and Friends, and forming one of the major political groupings of the period of Cromwell

shortdef: one that is independent; especially, often capitalized : one that is not bound by or definitively committed to a political party

a sectarian of an English religious movement for congregational autonomy originating in the late 16th century, giving rise to Congregationalists, Baptists, and Friends, and forming one of the major political groupings of the period of Cromwell

dt: {bc}formation of random combinations of chromosomes in meiosis and of genes on different pairs of homologous chromosomes by the passage according to the laws of probability of one of each diploid pair of homologous chromosomes into each gamete independently of each other pair

shortdef: formation of random combinations of chromosomes in meiosis and of genes on different pairs of homologous chromosomes by the passage according to the laws of probability of one of each diploid pair of homologous chromosomes into each gamete independently of each other pair

dt: {bc}a city in the state of Virginia having a status equivalent to that of a county

shortdef: a city in the state of Virginia having a status equivalent to that of a county

dt: {bc}a mathematical variable that is independent of the other variables in an expression or function and whose value determines one or more of the values of the other variables

shortdef: a mathematical variable that is independent of the other variables in an expression or function and whose value determines one or more of the values of the other variables

dt: {bc}a clause that could be used by itself as a simple sentence but that is part of a larger sentence

shortdef: a clause that could be used by itself as a simple sentence but that is part of a larger sentence

dt: {bc}a person hired to do work who controls how the work is done

dt.t: They hired an {it}independent contractor{/it} to fix the roof.

shortdef: a person hired to do work who controls how the work is done

dt: {bc}a course of study done by a student without an instructor or with help from an instructor but not as part of an organized class

dt.t: She is doing an {it}independent study{/it} in Art History this semester.

shortdef: a course of study done by a student without an instructor or with help from an instructor but not as part of an organized class

dt: {bc}a type of suspension (the parts of a vehicle that connect the body to the wheels) in which each wheel has its own set of supports for the body of the vehicle

shortdef: a type of suspension (the parts of a vehicle that connect the body to the wheels) in which each wheel has its own set of supports for the body of the vehicle
